title: The Chronicle Of Pierre De Langtoft In French Verse, From The Earliest Period To The Death Of King Edward I
description: The Chronicle of Pierre de Langtoft in French Verse, from the Earliest Period to the Death of King Edward I is a historical work translated and edited by Thomas Wright. The book chronicles the early history of England, from the arrival of the Saxons to the death of King Edward I. Written in French verse by Pierre de Langtoft, a 13th-century Benedictine monk, the chronicle provides a unique perspective on the events of the time. The book covers the reigns of various kings, including William the Conqueror, Henry II, and Richard the Lionheart, and includes details about battles, political intrigue, and religious conflicts. The translation and editing by Thomas Wright provide valuable insights into the language, culture, and history of medieval England.
